intro: Psychotria lupulina var. maypurensis, commonly known as the Maypurensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and understorey environments.
